Company:AHI agilon health, inc.Job Posting Location:Remote - MAJob Title:Principal Data ScientistJob Description:At agilon health, we partner with physician groups to provide value-based care to senior patients. Our total care model is transforming healthcare by empowering PCPs to focus on the entire health of their patients, via quality of care, not volume of fees. We honor the independence of local physicians and serve as their long-term partners so they can be the doctors they trained to be.As a principal data scientist at agilon, you will tackle and solve some of the hardest problems in healthcare. Your modeling work will address use cases ranging from helping physicians make more accurate medical diagnoses to identifying patients who are at risk of not taking their medications. You will own the full end-to-end ML development lifecycle: engaging with stakeholders to scope out clinical and business opportunities, conceptualizing and training highly accurate predictive deep learning models, deploying models on agilon’s MLOps platform in AWS, and iterating and improving model accuracy over time.As a member of agilon’s Data Science team, you will join a community of enthusiastic data scientists dedicated to using ML to change health care. We have an agile team structure, a lively culture, and tremendous opportunity to grow with and within agilon.The models you train will be used directly in workflows that support agilon’s patients. Your work will make a difference in the lives of our patients and physicians.Job Functions: Design, train, and deploy predictive models to support a wide range of health care use cases, leveraging deep learning and LLM/generative architectures.Lead project teams, mentor junior data scientists, and collaborate with clinical and operational stakeholders across agilon.Build production-quality pipelines for model training and inference, using agilon’s MLOps stack in AWS.Work with large clinical datasets from agilon’s Data Lake, drawn from a diverse set of data sources.Stay current with recent advances in machine learning and other technologies for value-based care, and strategically target publication opportunities based on project work.Work a hybrid schedule from agilon’s beautiful office in Burlington, MA (including free access to an excellent on-site fitness center). Strong remote-only candidates will also be considered.Qualifications:Advanced degree (PhD, MS) in a quantitative field such as machine learning, statistics, economics, population health, epidemiology, or computer science.Five to eight years of experience training deep learning models, ideally with hands-on experience with large language models (LLMs).Expert proficiency in Python and SQL.At least five years of experience working in a production environment, or five years of research experience (e.g., as documented by publications).Proven experience leading scrum teams and collaborating with stakeholders on ML opportunities.If you have an entrepreneurial spirit, a record of successful model development, and are excited about leveraging deep learning to have a meaningful impact on doctors and patients, we would love to hear from you.Location:Remote - MAPay Range:$153,000.00 - $191,300.00Salary range shown is a guideline. Individual compensation packages can vary based on factors unique to each candidate, such as skill set, experience, and qualifications.
